Given a string $s$ and a substring $t$, find the number of ways to divide $s$ into $k$ non-overlapping substrings such that each substring contains $t$ as a substring. 

The substrings can be of any length, but they must be non-overlapping.  

Print the answer modulo $10^9 + 7$.
Given a string and a smaller string, count how many times you can split the larger string into pieces so that each piece contains the smaller string.
